Reviews.Title: Terrible
Reviews.Author: Susanne Lueders
Reviews.Content: This camera is terrible! It would never use the flash and as a result all pictures were blurry. It also took forever for the camera to even take a picture. I tried to take a picture of my son, but the camera was so slow to react that he had already walked out of the picture! Also, the tough screen is awful! Anything close to the edge hardly ever reacted. I thought I got a deal, but in the end I got what I paid for - low quality. I just received a canon and after only taking a few picture I already know that it was worth spending an extra $100. So, do yourself a favor and buy a decent camera for a little more money!

Reviews.Title: Horrible camera
Reviews.Author: Amanda
Reviews.Content: I would not buy this camera again if the ygave it to me. horrible quality. dont even try and do video.

Reviews.Title: Fuji Z-90 Blue - COMPLETELY DISAPPOINTING~!
Reviews.Author: RickLS
Reviews.Content: I have owned this Blue z-90 camera for close to 3 months now, is a cool looking camera really like the blue though I keep finding myself, (yepp) a "bit BLUE". I bought through Fuji directly replacing an older wore out camera "Fuji J-38"  I had for over 2 years. Fuji offered me a great bundle price of 99.00 included a 4 gig card and extra battery and folding case. that seemed a pretty Good deal! since I got it in early March, I have used it inside, outside, scenic pics,  my Daughter's wedding at the end of March, a "REALLY BIG DEAL"  some of them turned out well most of the event was outside until the reception. (all's I can say  is I am TRULY Thankfull there were MANY other camers happily SHUTTER-A-BUGGIN away so between many, we got a large pool of good pics to work with - i had the same results at the Phoenix Zoo some 'z' turned out the shutter time dragged missed some rare "critter" shots, again Really glad my kids had 3 other cameras churnin and a burnin floating around to dump int to the batches or foldrers.  Also at at a major league ballgame though mostly of my 3 year old grandson to a recent rock concert, (about 50/60 feet from stage), didn't have to hide it, cameras were permitted, just not video, those pictures, once the dust settled, back home, viewing on my computer, only 1 of about 10 were any good - I  took well over 200.  I wound up with a LOT of distorted blurry mess that are just sitting in a folder not having the heart to just delete them all yet -  A "REAL BUMMER!"  I  have taken hundreds, possibly thousands of pictures my grandson since I got this. I keep him though the weekdays daily shooting & creating weekly folders- constantly catching him,  (or trying to catch him playing outside riding his bike, to just posing something cute - inside same thing,  many not very good- sadly.... I have missed A LOT of Great pictures because the "Z" is like the end of the alphabet, (takes forever to get to)  = a horrible delay from the time I use the top button or even the tap screen or the shutter finally clicks.  EVER TRY to get  a 3 year old to hold or repose something cute they did? expression? or action? tell him wait for the flash (forget it) - gone......-  Very disappointed. the focus doesn't do so good and I have not found a setting that "PLAYS WELL WITH OTHERS" yet - I'm not TOO crazy about the video results of this critter either Have attempted many shots of bike riding, kite flying, bubble blowing, not exactly really good results as I keep trying to 'chew threw the "micro print of the manuel of the camera. - Another real concern, The design (who ever created  this littl monster was obviously Right handed and has NO clue or concern about left handed folks, the lens is in the UPPER left corner of the camera, if you are left handed, (I am ambidextrous so I use both hands equally,) I wind up using my left a lot without realizing it- the problem with that? Just trying to grab a quick shot of something fun going on,  I wind up getting the top of the subject, grandkid or one of my kids head or something cut off by a finger or thumb, can't edit out a thumb covering a face, sadly A FIST FULL of these IS creating "K.I.A.s "Crashed and burned on this runway causing many to go down in flames of losses meaning a lot of pics just not worth trying to save to that cause (figuratively) just to the junk folder -YEPP I actually have a z-90 trash pic folder, perhaps I 'll sane it & send to fuji - someday just for grins,  entitled "SEE WHAT I MEAN?" it  gets bigger, ALL the Time :/  Trying to use the "LCD screen as the only point of reference to "framing the subject" (especially outside)  mostly the littl guy to an occasional helicopter flying overhead - is all but lost, (unless in complete shade) the image "washed out" on the screen  leaving me to just "click away" I am coming to the conclusion that this not a "point and shoot camera, is a "point and HOPE" you get something camera. this is my 3rd Didgital camera I have owned and have used more I was really looking to this littl gem would be a continuum of the J-38 model I had from before, was a GREAT camera,  simple, good reaction time and very good clean presentable pictures and video clips, both inside and out - my experience so far. The z-90, I find has gone in the opposite direction. I think I need to start looking for another camera, because I find this "COMPLETELY DISAPPOINTING!"~

Reviews.Title: Nice, durable- Simple Camera for those of us on the go...
Reviews.Author: Peppermint&Lilac; "P&L;"
Reviews.Content: I've owned a Nikon that I didn't care for, and a GREAT Sony Touchscreen (around 500$) that got stolen, and then I had a Fujifilm fine pix model from 2009. When I dropped my fujifilm in Santorini I new it was a goner. However, I had dropped it about 15 times previous so i wouldn't call it delicate. Anyway, I narrowed down my cameras and finally decided that I didn't want to spend more than about 140$ and if I had a fujifilm I enjoyed why not get another. This one is VERY EASY TO USE IF YO HAVE TROUBLE WITH ELECTRONICS. The touchscreen isn't that sensitive but I'm used to my ipod touch's sensitivity. It has a great panoramic mode !!! I highly recommend it for that. I could use my old fujifilm camera's batter and charger in case i loose this one or need a double battery! The pictures come out decent. It's not a 1000$ camera so you get what you pay for but honestly for someone who doesn't need complex photo settings it's perfect. It also has a setting called "touch and shoot" where you see an object in the screen , touch it and it focuses on that object and shoots it the best possible way. Very cool.

Reviews.Title: Some interesting features, but poor image quality!
Reviews.Author: Michael A. Duvernois
Reviews.Content: This is a nicely sized compact camera, turns on and off with a sliding lens cover, and has a touch screen for all but the fundamental controls. And the problems start there, it's a not a very sensitive touch screen and if you've ever used a good touch screen (iPhone etc.) then this one will be very frustrating! And it gets worse, the image quality is quite poor. This seems to be a marketing choice aimed at folks who want a high number of megapixels. There are 14 million very small pixels here and there is considerable noise in those pixels. Couple that with iffy optics and you have poor image quality in both normal and low light levels.So, some nice ideas with the lens cover switch and touch screen, but they're swamped by the poor images and so-so implementation of the touch screen. There are lots of better camera choices out there.

Reviews.Title: nice camera
Reviews.Author: Deb A
Reviews.Content: Great camera, very user friendly. nice size and weight. Bought the camera for my 70 year old mother and she loves it. Takes great pictures.

Reviews.Title: Amazon.com
Reviews.Author: arnold acevedo
Reviews.Content: lost the first I had, I,ordered two more(same model) just in case I need to replace this two I just bought, now., this camera it is great,I was happy to find it in amazon..thank you much A.A

Reviews.Title: everything works ok but..
Reviews.Author: michael bowden
Reviews.Content: everything seems to work ok. i like the touch screen, but the bottom left corner only works sometimes. but i still love it, my first camera ever!

Reviews.Title: First Fuji camera
Reviews.Author: George Buczala
Reviews.Content: The first one arrived very quickly -1/3. I took about 4 and it pictures STOP. Called Outlet and made arrangements to return it. No problem  The replacement arrive 1/24.  These were the snags. I enjoy the camera. It is what I want - something I could place in a shirt pocket.Considering the no hassle and the cameras feathers. I probably should give the whole experience 5starsSide comment why doesn't Amazon accept paypal?

Reviews.Title: Not the best
Reviews.Author: Tiff
Reviews.Content: my camera phone takes better pics than this fuji.  I barely use the camera but it has served a purpose previously.

Reviews.Title: Excellent store
Reviews.Author: Hugo L. S. Barbosa
Reviews.Content: Excelent store. Everything was as expected with product and product deliver on time. Everything perfect buying from them and I would buy with them again.

Reviews.Title: BEAUTIFUL
Reviews.Author: HECTOR "Hector J. Abundis Jr."
Reviews.Content: I LOVE THIS CAMERA.. EXCELLENT QUAILTY,.. THE SELLER IS A GREAT ONE... VERY FAST SHIPPING ... I WOULD BUY ANOTHER.. IM LEARNING MUCH MORE IN COLLGE ABOUT PHOTOGRAPHY, AND THIS QUALITY IS AWESOME

Reviews.Title: Just what I expected
Reviews.Author: Skeeter Miller
Reviews.Content: I had a camera just like this one and the lens got cracked when it was pulled out of my hand and hit the floor.  I wanted to get another one just like my old camera so I purchased this one.  It is working just as I expected and I'm very pleased with it.

Reviews.Title: DONT GET THIS CAMERA!!!!!!!!!
Reviews.Author: Katycat
Reviews.Content: I was going to buy this camera, and wanted to see it in person, so, I went to Target. When I got there, one of the workers asked me if I needed any help. I say no, I'm probably going to get that camera over there. I point to this camera. He tells me how this camera is super slow, super blurry, and almost every time someone buys it, they return it the next day. I am never going to buy this camera.

Reviews.Title: My son loves this camera!
Reviews.Author: Carolyn Dai
Reviews.Content: My son chose this camera and he's loved using It.  It's a great 1st camera for a 10 year old, techie-inclined kid!

Reviews.Title: Very nice
Reviews.Author: D. Hamilton "Don H."
Reviews.Content: Its small and produces very picture. It has a lot of modes that work great. You will love the wide picture also. I bought one and fixing to buy another for gift

Reviews.Title: Christmas gift!!!!
Reviews.Author: Gerald A. Kirkland
Reviews.Content: I have purchased fugi cameras before and have not been dissappointed by their quality. I am happy to say that this remains the truth with this camera.

Reviews.Title: Fujifilm FinePix Z90 14 MP Digital Camera with Fujinon 5x Wide Angle
Reviews.Author: nadine charles
Reviews.Content: Just loved the item, and it was just as the pictured stated, therefore i'm happy with my purchase, oh joy i have no regrets.

Reviews.Title: works as advertised
Reviews.Author: Ben
Reviews.Content: After reading reviews and getting the camera, it works exactly as advertised, so I have no complaints. I was looking for an inexpensive camera that would take good pictures and after a couple months of testing it works just fine.

Reviews.Title: Really
Reviews.Author: Tedrick Stone
Reviews.Content: This is my favorite camera. Compact, clear, easy to use and pretty to. Of course, there is the thing about a good price and good service but, it is just a sharp little camera. I bought two.

Reviews.Title: nice camera
Reviews.Author: Samantha Mcwilliams "amazon fan"
Reviews.Content: It's what I've always wanted no more batteries and it is just wonderful for the price and easy to use and takes wonderful pics

Reviews.Title: Camera quit within 2 months
Reviews.Author: kbenson
Reviews.Content: Such a neat design for a camera.  Our complaint is that it just quit!  We even have a replacement battery, but to no avail.  It won't work anymore.  No reason.  It hasn't been dropped or had any trauma to it at ALL.  We got it at Christmas and it died by February.  Won't buy again.

Reviews.Title: Nice Camera
Reviews.Author: pjlld
Reviews.Content: I like the size, easy to put in pocket or purse.  I've taken it outside for pics and seems to do great.Also have used it in low lighting and not bad.For the price and convenience, it's great.

Reviews.Title: Not good
Reviews.Author: Linda Connors
Reviews.Content: The camera was out of focus it wouldn't take clear pictures, It may have been just this camera I don't know but shared to purchase a new one.

Reviews.Title: Very Nice
Reviews.Author: Michael R. Petrick
Reviews.Content: Great features, nice, easy to use, but struggles with a clear view on the screen & taking night pictures. Wish I knew what we were doing wrong...probably a user problem...but expected more with all the great promos about it. Maybe soemone can give us some tips :)

Reviews.Title: Horrible indoors, not too bad outdoors
Reviews.Author: B. Riff
Reviews.Content: The biggest draw to this camera was the panoramic shots. The ones that I shot while on vacation were pretty darn cool! However, I'm not impressed with the camera in any other way. While it turns on quickly, you cannot scroll through pictures or zoom in or out (in view mode) quickly. It takes forever! Also, this camera is horrible indoors. My pictures come out, not blurry, but... as though every pixel itself is blurry. I've tried every setting I can possibly find and still cannot take satisfactory pictures indoors. Outdoors usually come out good, but there are still some "blurry" ones and many that are not true to color. Even though the panoramic shots are REALLY cool, I still do not recommend this camera. I'm going back to Canon.

Reviews.Title: Fantastic deal
Reviews.Author: Anitta York
Reviews.Content: I love this camera and the package deal. It saved me money and is easy to use. I liked it so well my husband got one too.

Reviews.Title: Good for the price
Reviews.Author: J.L.
Reviews.Content: This is a good camera for the price, though I sent it back. I thought I'd be happy with a basic point and shoot, but this one just didn't do it for me. This camera does not work well in low light situations and had trouble keeping colors true. Indoor photos looked very yellow.This is a good camera for the price point, but if you care about the quality of your photos I would recommend spending a little more and getting camera in a little higher price range. I sent this one back and purchased this one instead: Sony Cyber-shot DSC-WX50 16.2 MP Digital Camera with 5x Optical Zoom and 2.7-inch LCD  (Silver) (2012 Model)  It is a bit more money but you won't regret it!

Reviews.Title: first time buy
Reviews.Author: polly
Reviews.Content: I bought it for my aunt and she loves it.The person selling it was right on the moneyabout what they wrote about the product,  Thanks

Reviews.Title: Terrible in low light, video is yellow-tinted, and slow shutter speed
Reviews.Author: S. Fisher
Reviews.Content: I have had this camera for a year and I'm so glad to finally be getting rid of it and upgrading to a Nikon 5100 DSLR.  The Fuji Finepix has been a source of such frustration for me over the last year; I don't know why I kept it as long as I did.  Any indoor video that I have taken is extremely dark and has a yellow-orange tint to it.  The outdoor pictures seem to be fine but almost every indoor picture I have taken with this camera is a big disappointment.  Does not perform well at all in indoor lighting even if I turn on every light and lamp in the room!  Additionally, the camera has a slow start up and a long delay from the time I depress the button until the picture actually takes, which has caused me to miss many, many special moments with my baby over the last year (such as capturing cute little grins, and first moments).  I would not recommend this camera at all.

Reviews.Title: Great camera and features!
Reviews.Author: Duante Barnett
Reviews.Content: Bought this camera for $77 instead of the suggested retail price of $219.99 so for what I PAID it was a great deal and a wonderful camera. Has a ton of features and has an EXCELLENT screen. For $77, this is a 5 STAR camera. I am not sure if I paid the FULL $220 I would have given it higher than 3.5 stars though. Good picture quality, compact and overall NICE camera!

Reviews.Title: Fujifilm Finepix Camera
Reviews.Author: Alice
Reviews.Content: Good, easy to use camera, great for instant day time and landscape shots. Not particularly durable, so if you're likely to drop it, be aware, and the night time mode makes everything look very, very trippy - all orangey and night club-esque. Whilst I quite like this look for photos of myself and friends, it's certainly not good for evening time use in a non-going out setting. Other than that, this is my second of this camera - great value for the quality that you get.

Reviews.Title: OK
Reviews.Author: R. Dudik "the six d's"
Reviews.Content: Its pretty good, but the bad part is that its a touch screen. the touch screen might be good for you, i use it for fishing so my hands are dirty.Okay

Reviews.Title: Decent
Reviews.Author: SumoPDX
Reviews.Content: I tried it a few times and it works alright thou nothing esPectacular.Tried take some pics of the full moon (it was a blue moon) and it was impossible. An IPhone seems to do a better job for this.I went on a hike and pics came out pretty good. Does also a good job portraits.

Reviews.Title: Fujifilm fine pix
Reviews.Author: Kit
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera maily due to the enclosed lense. I work in a hot & dusty environment and telescopic lenses just cant survive. This camera is small enough to stick in a pocket and very easy to use, simply slide the front cover and snap your photos. Photo review again is simple click the forward/play button and simply scan you pictures. Happy days simple but effective.

Reviews.Title: Fujifilm FinePix Z90
Reviews.Author: Joel B Eiseman
Reviews.Content: I purchased this as a gift for my wife.  We are both pleased with the quality of each picture taken.  This little camera seems to adjust itself to many different situations.  So far the only bad quality shots we have are those of our own doing by jerking or rushing a shot, otherwise, a great little camera.

Reviews.Title: Great camera
Reviews.Author: Marcos
Reviews.Content: This is a great camera for the features and the price, very easy to use and take very nice pictures. I will recommend this camera to anyone.

Reviews.Title: Impresive Little Bundle
Reviews.Author: Anna Hope
Reviews.Content: I was really impressed with this camera. It's sleek, it's stylish and easy to keep in a small purse without feeling like your hauling a brick around. While not a professional level of quality, the photos come out quite crisply and the color is good. I don't use the Facebook easy link so I can't speak about that but I have been impressed with the Fujifilm customer service.

Reviews.Title: Fuji Z90
Reviews.Author: Michael Patnode
Reviews.Content: First camera was defective! Zoom lens error! Second one arrived promptly and works as well as advertised! Easy to carry and easy to use!

Reviews.Title: Nice little camera
Reviews.Author: DQ
Reviews.Content: This is a great little point and shoot camera with a fairly intuitive 3" touch screen. The camera is not much bigger than the screen it holds, is quite slim and very light, making it the ideal camera to slip into a pocket or purse. The wide angle lens is wide enough for most indoor shots, making it very handy in tight spaces when you want to get the whole group into the shot. The automatic settings work quite well and there is a reasonable amount of manual control for those who want it. The HD Video camera takes excellent quality video...even the audio is fairly good. Nice.

Reviews.Title: Easy Point And Shoot...
Reviews.Author: Jerry Gamblin
Reviews.Content: This thing takes great pictures for the price. I am able to carry this in my backpack and not be overly concerned if it gets scratched up.The touch screen interface is a little clunky but I wouldn't expect it to be perfect for $80.

Reviews.Title: Very difficult settings, poor focus.  Not the best camera I've ever had
Reviews.Author: R. Verrando
Reviews.Content: I've had three or four digital pocket cameras in my life, so I know how they work.  This is a nice-looking unit, but I could not get it take focused pictures no matter what I did.  The only way it will take a clear picture is in bright outdoor light or from a tripod, and I could not figure out how to adjust the flash or shutter speed to improve the situation.  I'm no dummy, but neither the camera menu, the manual or the website offered any help.

Reviews.Title: It's just OK
Reviews.Author: A. Gift For You "ATL G"
Reviews.Content: Owning mulitple Cannon Elph's, I thought I'd give Fujifilm a try.  Night and Day comparison.  Cannon seems to rule the point and shoot market, rightfully so.  Although the zoom works, the quality of the photo is sacrificed.  Not so with Cannon.  I've researched the web for technical specs and there appear to be detailed work-arounds to problems with this model.  Point and Shoot ease is not this camera's forte.

Reviews.Title: digital camera
Reviews.Author: bonnie
Reviews.Content: I am very happy with the camera. It is a nice compact size and takes very good pictures. The delivery was very fast and the prices for the camera,case,and memory cards were very reasonable.

Reviews.Title: A better gift to replace a camera phone, but not a great camera for high picture quality
Reviews.Author: Erik1988
Reviews.Content: I originally had the Kodak EasyShare V550 5MP Digital Camera with 3x Optical Zoom (Black)Then my wife wanted something with more "umph" and so we bought the Sony Cybershot DSCW90 8.1MP Digital Camera with 3x Optical Zoom and Super Steady Shot (Black)Both previous cameras were based on ratings in Consumer Reports (1-year auto-renewal) and we've been happy with both cameras. Actually I still use the Kodak for my eBay auctions and we use the Sony for everything else.I received this Fuji and have the following feedback. . .1. This is NOT a $300-$400 Sony, so I can tell a difference between picture quality. As one review mentioned I had poorer results with indoor pictures than when I took it to the lake and took pictures outdoors2. There manual is non-existent! I guess they assume you can understand the options when scrolling through the touch-screen menu, but I found this to be lacking and had to experiment to know exactly what each setting did or didn't do.3. The unit comes with a 4Mb memory card, USB cable, a software CD and a battery charger. That's it. No cradle, not even a cheap cloth cover to put over the unit to keep it from getting scratched in your pocket, purse or backpack.4. What I really liked is the lens protection was superb, as a front "plate" slides over the lens. This is also how you turn it on/off, but sliding the plate away from the lens.5. The quality of both outdoor & indoor pictures on the display is grainy and awful. But once you upload your pictures and view them. they look much, much better. Thus don't judge your pictures by what the camera on the touchscreen shows it to look like. The screen is really only for lining up the shot, not for image review.6. I still can't figure out how to use it for video recording. Again lack of manual to explain the camera settings is frustrating.7. The images when saved to the computer are around 3-4Mb each and very high resolution, when set to the medium settings. I used a free program like Picasa to edit the size and quality.The camera does have a setting for Image size of:Large 4:3  14M  631 framesLarge 16:9 10M  836 framesMed 4:3 7M  1261 framesMed 16:9  5M 1637 framesSmall 4:3 3M  2850 framesSmall 16:9  2M 4137 framesTotal newbie to cameras so I have no idea what any of this means. Guess we'll have to research since again...nothing explained in the manual.8. Quality settings in camera can be set to Fine or Normal only.9. You do have a color setting of Standard, B&W; and Sepia. I think this is cool!10. The touch screen is responsive and the buttons big enough that they are easy to push without accidently pushing other buttons by mistake11. I didn't bother with the software they provide because those are typically low-feature freebies vs. something robust like Picasa. I don't need another installed on my computer that I'll never use. Picasa identified the camera just fine, no additional drivers were needed on Windows 7.Back in the day, my Kodak was much more expensive than it is now, but as far as picture quality is concerned the Kodak 5 megapixal seems pretty comparable with this 14 megapixal. Thus I think it is more appropriate to compare your existing $100 camera against whether you should get this or not vs like me with my $350 Sony.For $100 I'm good with my small kids messing with this camera and will continue to see about quality settings and battery life (which is holding up pretty good so far).But you get what you pay for in this price range:  an okay camera with a nice touch screen, nice color and good lens protection. Good gift for that young person in your life who wants something more than what their camera phone will provide them.

Reviews.Title: Solid mid range camera
Reviews.Author: J. N. Mohlman
Reviews.Content: The FujiFilm Z90 is a solid point and shoot camera that fits nicely in the middle range of the camera market.  As another reviewer pointed out, the 14 MP resolution is what seems to set it apart, but unless you are printing poster sized pictures you aren't ever going to realize any benefit from the higher mega-pixels.  So if you are looking at that attribute and thinking you are getting a bargain on a high end camera, you aren't.  However, this is a solid, flexible device that definitely fits a need.Featuring the aforementioned 14 megapixels, a solid 5x optical zoom and the ability to shoot 720P HD video, the Z90 can do a lot of different things reasonably well, and does so in a robust, attractive package.  In particular, the lens is completely covered when the camera is off, making it ideal for carrying in a pocket or purse, or stashing in the glove compartment for unexpected photo opportunities.  Obviously everyone will use this camera differently, but for me it fits perfectly in the niche where I don't want to carry my larger, heavier Sony CyberShot, but want something more robust than my cell phone camera, i.e. concerts, kids sporting events, etc.  It's not necessarily the kind of camera you want to rely on to record the first hours of your child's life or a wedding, but for everyday use it more than fits the bill.In fact, the ideal consumer of this camera, to my mind, is a high-schooler or recent graduate.  As people who likely won't have/can't afford a high end smartphone or more expensive SLR camera, the Z90 is the perfect fit.  It's robust, feature rich, portable and reasonably priced which makes it perfect for someone in the 15-25 demographic.  Likewise, if you already have a more expensive, but bigger, SLR camera but are looking for something more portable and less fragile to keep around for unexpected moments, this is also an excellent option.Finally, I should mention that while the technical description indicates the phone does not come with a memory card, mine came with a 4 GB card in the box.  I don't know if this is because there is an error in the description or because I received the camera through the Vine Program, but hold off on buying a card until the camera arrives, just in case.

Reviews.Title: Great camera
Reviews.Author: S. Becker
Reviews.Content: I have used this several times since I purchased it. It works great! This is by far the best camera I've ever owned.

Reviews.Title: Fine
Reviews.Author: Juli A. Lee "JingleJL"
Reviews.Content: I have quite a few digital cameras and this is one of my favorites.  First, I love the style - different...................classy.  Love the touch screen.  If you are a camera buff - definitely for you.  I liked it so much I also got the FujiFilm Fine Pix EXR - same camera - more features.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera!
Reviews.Author: B. Grackin
Reviews.Content: Just as the description said-it is easy to use and durable.  The touchscreen works well and there are not a ton of settings for the average photographer.

Reviews.Title: Did not come with card
Reviews.Author: Yvonne M. Lebris
Reviews.Content: I still have to read up on it to figure out how to use it but I noticed that it did not come with the card., and wanted to know why.  All the cameras that I have bought came with the card.  Please answer this question.  Thank you.

Reviews.Title: Great order
Reviews.Author: Jason John "JJohn"
Reviews.Content: Like order I will order again if needed. It was a gift for my sister it's great purchase thank you.

Reviews.Title: perfect!
Reviews.Author: R. Williams
Reviews.Content: Bought this camera for my daughter for Christmas this year, she LOVES it! It was so easy to just take it out of the box and start using it! She is very happy with it and I am happy with the good deal I got as well.

Reviews.Title: great little camera
Reviews.Author: Sharrose
Reviews.Content: I am still learning this camera however it takes great pictures so far..not sure I like that wheel thing I may just have to get use to it

Reviews.Title: camera review
Reviews.Author: mitcheeboy
Reviews.Content: camera was a little different than I was accustomed to, but does a great job. I kept on looking for the words water resistant or water proof, but all is ok.

Reviews.Title: Nice features, poor quality pictures
Reviews.Author: eyecore
Reviews.Content: This is my first experience with a FujiFilm camera, and I can honestly say that I was my first impression was that of being...impressed.The camera has quality feeling with reasonable heft (made of metal, not plastic), the menus in the camera are very intuitive (the touch-screen seems kind of a gimmick, but with that said, the entire touch-screen-menu sytem does work great.)  The multitude of options that I haven't seen in other brands of cameras is impressive, as well.For example, you can set the camera to "follow" an object.  That is, you see it on the screen, you touch it, and if the object moves (or you move the camera), the camera stays focused and has a cross-air moving with it.  I'm not entirely sure when I'd use that feature - but it certainly has a cool factor to it.But after the initial awe of a new camera, eventually you have to use it.  And quality pictures were an uphill battle:  The camera simply doesn't take good pictures.Low light?  Pixelated pictures.  The slightest movement?  Blurry pictures.  Using zoom?  Blurry pictures.  (It feels like there's no image stabilization whatsoever.)  Daylight, unzoomed picture with no movement?  Oversaturated pictures with too much contrast.  Everything looked like a higher megapixel version of a chintzy phone camera.I tried swapping out of the "auto" mode(s) to manually set up the type of picture and it wasn't any better.One of the few pluses of the camera allow you to zoom while recording video (and the video has it's own one-touch buttons, another plus), but the video isn't very sharp, and zooming during the video worsens the quality.  And regardless of your memory card (speed and size), your video length is limited to around 12 minutes.  (Tested with SDHC 32GB, Class 10 down to a Class 4, 4GB.)Another plus is that the macro mode (closeups) works very well, and was one of the few modes that would produce a picture that wasn't blurry.On the chance that you come across this camera and you just want a fuzzy picture to email to grandma, the other big problem with this little red Fuji is ergonomics.  Specifically, the location of the lens.  While most manufacturers try to keep the lens somewhat centered, this one is aligned DIRECTLY on top of the camera, so if you hold a camera with both hands while taking a picture, you're likely going to end up with a few pictures of your finger.  (Or worse, an oily lens as your finger rubs against it.)It'd be nice to think that I just got a dud that takes bad pictures, but I have nothing to back that up.  While I'd love to have a higher-end Fuji camera to play with all the interesting options (or even the same camera if it took crisp pictures), I can't see myself ever seriously considering another Fuji based on the poor picture quality of this one.  (And seriously folks, the purpose of a camera is to take pictures, good ones - doesn't matter if the menu/screen operate by touch or if it can read my mind; if it can't take a good picture, its not worth having.)Despite the Fuji having better specs (megapixel, touch-screen goodness, better zoom), for cameras in this range, I'd recommend the Panasonic Lumix DMC-S1 12.1 MP Digital Camera with 4x Optical Image Stabilized Zoom with 2.7-Inch LCD (Black) over this one.  Regardless, I wouldn't recommend this camera.

Reviews.Title: Horrible
Reviews.Author: Hubb
Reviews.Content: Please Please Please do not buy this camera. The only reason why I decided to buy this was because I desperately needed a camera on the spot for a vacation I was going to go on. The touch screen was cool at first, but got annoying during my vacation when I wanted to simply go to the menu option and crop a picture. For a $159.99 camera, it's such a bummer! There are no cool features. It's just a simple point and shoot with the added on "touch screen" that no one really needs anyway. But the most horrible part about this camera was that it's pictures would not upload onto Facebook. This wouldn't be such an issue for me, but right on the box it clearly states that it's "Easy to upload on Youtube and Facebook!" When that clearly is not the case at all. You have to go through a program that they provide just to get through to either website. I hated it so much. It took me DAYS for me to figure it out. I even went on the Fuji website and called for technical support, and got hung up TWICE. I'll never support or buy another Fuji product again. I went and returned my finepix, and got myself a Canon SD1400 for $149.99 (on sale). It was 10 dollars cheaper but SOOO much better. Go with a Canon!

Reviews.Title: Dead pixels on arrival
Reviews.Author: Fernando Garcia Diaz
Reviews.Content: I got this camera for my daughter Xmas present. After much anticipation and excitement it turns out that the camera screen has two vertical lines on the middle, indicative of dead pixels. I had to return it and got instead a Canon 100hs.

Reviews.Title: excellent camera
Reviews.Author: oscar b
Reviews.Content: I have my Fujifilm FinePix Z90 14 MP Digital, I have not used yet but looks super ... I arrive at the expected time and in good condition .. recommend thanks

Reviews.Title: great for a gift all in one package
Reviews.Author: jennifer smith
Reviews.Content: I love the gift all in one package and ready to wrap with the quality a great price for all I need for my daughter

Reviews.Title: As point & shoot cameras go...
Reviews.Author: terpfan1980 "Barry"
Reviews.Content: Point and shoot camera manufacturers have had a tough time lately.  The cameras built into smartphones are getting better and better and we're fast getting to the point that traditional camera manufacturers are having little or no success in maintaining their market.  Why carry around an extra camera when an iPhone 4 or a Droid phone can do just the job nearly as well or perhaps even better than most of the cameras at the lower end of market?Some would argue that manufacturers like Fuji have ramped up the Megapixel capacity of their cameras and made some improvements in their optical zoom ranges because of that competition from smartphones and that is a good thing, but at some point the megapixels don't really matter.  Don't get me wrong, to me, for my needs, higher range optical zoom rules.  As a frequent concert goer in the summer months having a camera with a good zoom range makes all the difference in getting a good shot or a nice video compared to a very poor shot or blurry and unrecognizable video.Realistically 5x optical zoom is about the minimum that I'd like on a camera and I think I'd really rather see something around the 8-10x optical zoom range (like, for example, in this recent Amazon offering: Panasonic Lumix DMC-FH20K 14.1 MP Digital Camera with 8x Optical Image Stabilized Zoom and 2.7-Inch LCD (Black), and even that is the lower end of what I'd like to see).  I know that I'd have to step up to much more expensive -- and heavier and less convenient for pockets -- such as my beloved Nikon Coolpix P100 10 MP Digital Camera with 26x Optical Vibration Reduction (VR) Zoom and 3.0-Inch LCD (Black) or nearly equally loved Sony Cybershot DSC-HX1 9.1MP 20x Optical Zoom Digital Camera with Super Steady Shot Image Stabilization and 3.0 Inch LCD.  Both of those are awesome at zooming in for great shots, but again, they are much more bulky and a pain to lug around.  In weight alone they wear a body down while hanging around the neck.With those comparisons and concerns aside, this is a servicable point and shoot camera.  I wouldn't put it at the top end, nor would I put it at the bottom.  Actually, in that bottom area, I could easily point at a lower end "waterproof" camera that I bought for my fiance and I to use while on our honeymoon later this year (Polaroid CXA-800YC 8MP Waterproof Digital Camera - Yellow).  The performance from that camera leaves much to be desired and makes me wish I hadn't bothered with purchasing it at the stores with the dog and red bullseye (partner to Amazon).Again, this is a reasonably good camera.  It's not the best, but if you are looking for the best there are options available here at Amazon and even from the same manufacturer (Fuji).  Note for this item you need to factor in a few additional requirements:  one, the installation of the software for "easy" uploading of content to Facebook or YouTube.  Personally I don't need such software and can handle my own uploading via more traditional means, but those that demand "easy" will wind up installing the software that Fuji makes available.  If you can't do the job without that software then this may bug you.  Consider that before purchase, but be aware it shouldn't be a showstopper.  There's also the need to add an SD memory card for storage. Most manfacturers don't bother to include a memory card with their cameras or include any real built-in capacity in their cameras, but you should still budget a little more to cover the costs of the memory card you eventually buy for use with the camera.Rechargable batteries (included) are a plus but can be a drag too as you can't simply run out to the store to get another set of AAA or AA batteries.  You can buy an extra rechargable battery and keep a spare handy, but again must factor that into the total cost of the item.I noted in the additional features that lens protection is good on this item.  The Finepix Z90 has a sliding lens/face cover on the front of the camera that protects the lens when you aren't using the camera.  I'd love to see something like that in place on the LCD display/touchscreen as my fiance's daughter recently encountered a broken LCD display on another camera she was going to be using.  I've got no clue how that display came to be broken, but without the display the lower end p&s; (point and shoot) cameras are useless.  Protecting the display when not in use would be a great feature but would, of course, add weight and realistically I must admit I have no clue how a cover could be installed that wouldn't obstruct the use of the display more than most users would like.  Call it wishful thinking I guess.

Reviews.Title: I was expecting something better
Reviews.Author: paulvillavi
Reviews.Content: It's a problem that you can't watch your photos or video in your TV, you need an accesorie, that's a big problem to me.

Reviews.Title: Very disappointed.
Reviews.Author: Will R.
Reviews.Content: After getting this camera, I realized that my phone takes significantly better pictures in all the conditions I tested in. Admittedly, I've got a samsung s3, which takes great pictures, but would expect more from a completely separate point & shoot.

Reviews.Title: ME ENCANTO EL ARTICULO
Reviews.Author: guillermina mota peguero
Reviews.Content: ESTE PRODUCTO ME ENCANTO TANTO QUE ABRI UN SAN PARA VENDERLE A MIS AMIGOS Y AHORA VOY A COMPRAR 10

Reviews.Title: Almost got us killed!
Reviews.Author: Chosenbygrace Notworks "eternian.wordpress.c0m"
Reviews.Content: While doing a typical fruit cargo run from the Alpha Fruit System to the Smellfu Tofu-sushi Bar Space station at Serious Lee Smells at Serious C (by the asteroid colony, the pink one) wait where was I, oh yeah so when I was activating the gummy-wormhole drive I heard this clicking sound in my purse, my male purse which I bought from, nevermind, so I heard this clickity clack clickity clack smack smack smack and I open my purse and this camera is going insane flashing like crazy and the flash started blinding me because it just would not stop so I threw my purse thinking the camera was going to explode or blind me permanently and it ended up hitting the navigator in the head and he hit the console and was also blinded by the intense flashing from the camera, well so he accidentally swerved to the right and we ended up 500 light years away in the Unknown Quadrant for Wandering Idiots. Well 2 years later I finally got back to Earth, after fighting off the Snog five times in a row, just to leave this review. I didn't even get any advanced technology out of all this, not even an advanced fruit bowl. This really sucks, I want my 2 years back and my ship repaired!!!!! The Snorg even stole my seat! Fujifilm should replace that too! Well, back to my fruit runs, so long Earth, have fun with your made in China products, try not to get repeatedly blinded and die from those weird toxic Chinese plastic smells that Amazon aka the China-Industrial Complex keeps spreading all over the planet like rotten butter, fools.

Reviews.Title: Ruined my Vacation
Reviews.Author: AKS24
Reviews.Content: I bought this Camera a day before my B-Day Vacation to Montego Bay Jamica. I forgot to buy an SD card, so I first had to take photos on the camera memory- Totally My Fault!!! I bought a SD card in Montego Bay for an arm and a leg, but I was Happy! I was flicking away, until I was on the BEACH- about 10 feet from the shore line and Puff!! The lens appeared foggy and humidity (Sunny 96F) or moisture (not a full on Water Splash) got between the slide front and the lens during my beach bathing suite shots and this Dumb Fuji Camera Completely Stop Working! My girlfriend and I were very careful with our cameras, we were switching back and forth so as to not have an accident and drop them or get them wet. Her Olympus camera kept shooting, and flicking away in the Exact Same Beach Conditions and this Fuji totally BROKE DOWN!! I was HIGHLY Irritated to say the least. Needless to say that was Day 3 of my 5 day vacation, and the Fuji Camera NEVER came back on AGAIN until I got home Saturday! I missed 2 days of vacation photos I can not get back. I know this was not a waterproof camera but I was not in the water, and I would hope it could still work in Humid areas, but I guess I expected too much. I will be returning this Fuji Junk for a Sony!

Reviews.Content: i had recieved my camera was excied i charge the battery first put in sdhc card when batter wasw charged put in camera as instucted to find the battery is defective slid bar on front of camera to turn on nothing dont want to send the whole thing back but plesase help with this defective battey.

Reviews.Title: I'm extremly upset
Reviews.Author: customer
Reviews.Content: Alright I bought this like less then a month ago. Im making a video and I have it standing on my desk. Then it simply tips over backwards and it didnt fall 3 feet to the ground, just backwards on the desk maybe 3 inches. I didnt even think anything was wrong but when I look at the camera I see the screen cracked now I can't touch it which means I can't control anything. Now i have to get a warrenty plan for accidental damage which means im paying 80 more for the 110 I payed for this I'm losing 80 dollers bc of a small small fall. THANKS A LOT FUJI
